sub_title: Technology & Management | Strategy | Growth | Partnership | Design Thinking | Business Analysis | Experience Innovation | People & Change
summary:
Introduction: Growing up, I would dismantle all my toys to see how and why they were built up in a certain way. While rebuilding them, I was successful at some and learnt from the rest. An inquisitive person with strong interpersonal skills defines my trait. Colleagues call me a self-starter, good team leader and a quick learner. I am a result-oriented person who is easily adjustable to new environment. Challenges are part of my life and I love to face new challenges so as to hone my skills.  My career objective is to work for a  Company/firm to bring sustainability using continuous improvement and optimisation.

Experience: I have worked for various companies ranging from Oil & Gas (Project for Shell, Tulip Oil), Software Engineering (Trinite Automation), Beverages (Innocent drinks, Heineken) and in Pharmaceutical Industry (Teva, Johnson & Johnson). I hold experience in delivering projects on-time, in-budget, in scope and with quality assurance.  

Roles and Responsibilities: My responsibility is to lead team, setup and deliver business technology projects. The teams that I manage consist of professionals from National and International backgrounds. I am responsible for the project's scope from start to finish. I focus on innovation in Process Improvement, Plant Maintenance and Safety Solutions. I am a Strong People's Manager with special interest in managing teams and individuals for growth and development. I acquire broad local and international experience (B2B and B2C) with stakeholders and suppliers. I showcase my line management skills by coaching the multi-disciplinary cross-functional teams and facilitating the projects. My key to success is based on pragmatic approach, honesty, and creativity.

My Management skills include:
•	Stakeholder management, Change Management, Risk Management,  Project delivery and Account Development.
•	Leading & setting priorities with multi-disciplinary teams using SCRUM, TPM, NPD, OPEX, CAPEX and coordinating with external suppliers. 

My Technical skills include:
•	knowledge of GMP, EHS, IQ, OQ, PQ, PLC, DCS, SCADA, MATLAB/Simulink, LABVIEW and Microsoft packages. 
•	Technical expertise relating to process control, instrumentation, automation, safety & integrity, HAZOP, FAT, SAT, MCPS, ULTIMO, CSR, CAPA, etc.  

Personal Traits: You will often find me hanging out with tech geeks/ management nerds. My thirst is quenched by exploring new places (circumnavigated around 20 countries and way more to go). 
Feel free to contact me via LinkedIn. I am always looking forward to an insightful conversation over a cup of coffee.

Basic Dutch Course (One week intensive Course at Regina Coeli Vught)

profile_positions.description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
• Coaching various industries (pharma, food & beverage and chemical customers) to improve their business production processes and realize their digital ambitions.
• Bringing IT and OT together in a connected factory and transforming it to a smart factory.
• Conducting workshops, analyzing business and production processes, facilitating in the preparation of a URS (User Requirement Specification), and Functional Design Specification (FDS).
• Translating business challenges of customers into concrete solutions by implementing Digital Strategy (as a service), Life Cycle Management strategy, Business Continuity Plan, Roadmap and Investment Planning to improve the way of working.
• Collaborating with marketing, sales, and operations by networking with customers and business partners to bring strategic growth mindset.
• Bringing digital transformation (5.0 dark factory) by leading, implementing, and delivering technology projects that supports & improves business activities on a tactical and strategic level (PLC, SCADA, MES, ERP).

Achievements as Business Consultant & Transformation Leader
•	Delivered presentation as an active speaker for Smart Industry Summit and addressed the digital trends for Pharma Industry 5.0.
•	As a Program Manager, I have created programs on Business Process Automation (BPA), New Product Development (NPD), and Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) for round table conferences applicable to various industries/manufacturing.
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant & Transformation Leader

profile_positions.description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
• Coaching multi- disciplinary teams for process control activities on shop floor & office and involved with completing the Factory from scratch till end using SCRUM, process development modifications (FAT, SAT, Commissioning).
• Driving continuous improvement (implemented 5S, TPM and SQCDP methods) in the Blender factory and office for better management.
• Reporting directly to the Site Director regarding the systems progress and advising strategies for maintenance & support.
• Performing internal audits and providing feedback for improvement to fill the performance gap (RCA, PDCA).
• Bringing digital transformation by transitioning from customised solution to standardize solution alongside leading, implementing, and delivering technology projects (warehouse management using AGV’s, Vision System, BMS, LIMS, inline measurements).
• Developing the roadmap for the maintenance, operations and engineering department and executing them according to priorities.
• Self-starter and a Go-getter attitude while performing daily control tasks/HSE check internally and externally (VOL-VCA Certified). 
• Supervising the suppliers & negotiating the cost, assuring the projects are running smoothly (first time right) and on time (within budget).
• Advising Operations Manager about F&B norms and guidelines to create improvement plans for optimization of automation systems (BAU). 
• Creating short- & long-term plan for production lines (KPI board) to achieve collaboration between Supply-chain & Operations. 

Achievements as Area Lead/C.I Manager
• Dedicatedly involved with launching a brand-new factory (Factory of the Future) which can produce Juices, smoothies, and lot more.
• Increased the productivity of plant by using Kaizen, delivering Knowledge Performance Indicators (KPI) for safety, quality, production and focussing on Sustainability by being a B-Corp organization and including electric trucks for transportation and using windmills & solar panels.
profile_positions.title: Area Lead/ C.I Manager

profile_positions.description:
Johnson & Johnson is a leading supplier of medical products and medicines throughout the world. It was founded  by Christopher Conway in 1969. 

Roles and Responsibilities:
•	Ensuring compliance (GMP) in every stage of a  project (software life-cycle management) starting from FAT, SAT, IQ, OQ, PQ to the final regulatory assessment stage (using NPD/OPEX).
•	Strong communication and documentation skills (Client requirements Specifications, System Requirements Specifications, Functional Documents, Project Plans, User stories, Test plans, Test scenarios, End to End scenarios, various types of reports, etc).
•	Providing timely response to changing priorities and efficiently combining different roles on the project – PM, BA, Test lead.
•	Working on multi-disciplinary projects  within tight deadlines and providing competencies in project planning, execution and monitoring.
•	Providing technical expertise related to process control,  Electrical Instrumentation & Automation projects (PLC, DCS and SCADA).
•	Organizing all operational activities related to project realization and monitoring safety & compliance during the project  implementation.  
•	Responsible for the project's scope and finance from start to finish and focusing on innovation in Process Improvement, Plant Maintenance (TPM) and Safety Solutions (HAZOP/SIL).  
•	Maintenance and budget management (ownership/CAPEX) of Process Control Systems E & M related operations (EHS).
•	Providing technical expertise relating to process control, instrumentation, automation, change management (CSR, CAPA).
•	Practising First Time Right Strategy (FTRS) by Plan Do Check Act (PDCA).

Achievements as Project Manager:
•	Ensuring effective support and management of the process control systems for the Medical Device Manufacturing Facility.
•	Resolving effectively the operational issues related to Process Control Systems and Project Management(supplier/vendor).
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Teva Pharmaceuticals is a  multinational pharmaceutical company. It specializes primarily in generic drugs. It is the largest generic drug manufacturer in the world and one of the 15 largest pharmaceutical companies worldwide.
Roles and Responsibilities:
• Managing stakeholders during realization of projects (using OPEX).
• Keeping attention to trivial details and having an eagle's eye for quality.
• Defining  technical requirements into benefits (B2B) and implementing First Time Right Strategy (FTRS) using Plan Do Check Act (PDCA).
• Monitoring product development lifecycle and performance in order to ensure integral ownership and management
•	Wrote multiple accepted Business cases to improve the structure of the departments and the processes.
•	Result-oriented Business Analyst with strong focus on customer experience, process and innovative solutions. 
•	Creating System Requirement Specification (SRS) for the change requests and new development.
• Discussing control strategies of processes & installation and performing root cause analysis (PLC, DCS and SCADA).
• Maintenance and management (ownership) of the Industrial software's (BMS, ULTIMO) of E & M related operations.
• Making Computer Status Reports (CSR's) and Corrective Action & Preventive Action (CAPA).
• Assigning the task to commissioning team and ensuring that the equipment works according to its specification (NPD).
• Developing the process and communicating details from the start of project development to its closure (Project Owner)

Achievements as Process Control Specialist:
• Optimisation of processes and installation by replacing Electronic Recorders by Multi-Channel Process Systems(MCPS)
• Provided Lifecycle Steering and Safety solutions for efficient delivery of manufacturing processes
profile_positions.title: Process Control Specialist/Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Heineken in Zoeterwoude is a technically advanced brewery. Total beer production is around 10 million hectoliters, of which over 60% is for export. 

Functions:

•	Leading  process automation projects and responsible for completing the project from scratch till end using NPIs (New Product Introductions), software development modifications (FAT, SAT) and TPM (Total Productive Management/Maintenance).
•	Realization and implementation of application software using High Level Batch Language (HLBL).
•	Planning and execution of the daily control tasks (HSE- Health, Safety and Environment Certified).
•	Initiating new developments and improvements in the field of automation by bringing Process Control Knowledge.
•	Working in accordance with DIN / Heineken norms, standards and guidelines (VOL-VCA Certified).

Achievements as a Lead Process Control Engineer:

•	Successfully launched a new product called Heineken 0.0 (zero alcohol) by being integral part of technical brewery team.
•	Increase in the productivity of plant by using Kaizen, Knowledge Performance Indicators (KPI) and World Class Operations Management (WCOM) for Amstel, Desparados and Sol.
profile_positions.title: Lead Process Control Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Ensuring functional assessment of electronic controls in existing and newly developed heating devices (boiler, HMI, room unit, heat pumps, solar collectors) at BDR Thermea. 

Functions:

•	Preparation and implementation of measurement procedures in the development (BED, FEED).
•	Collaborate with departments like Purchasing, Engineering & Quality Service (Detail Engineering).
•	Accommodating customer requirements to software requirements(Embedded Systems).
•	Testing in the development laboratory (FAT) and at site (SAT).
•	Setting the priorities together with Marketing and R & D (SCRUM).

Achievements as Lead Controls Engineer:

•	Development of smart control board for Remeha (The Netherlands), Baxi (Italy) and Brotje (Germany).
•	Development of Mark III HMI for De Dietrich (France).
profile_positions.title: Lead Controls Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Ensuring delivery of operation designs, instrumentation for Incident Management Exchange  and responsible for conducting feasibility studies and providing technical advice 

1 Defining the technical requirements of the client.
2 Writing functional specification and transitional schemes for the project.
3 Analyzing P&ID's and providing control knowledge.
4 Working as a lead by letting the team focused on its goal.
5 Managing sprints and implementing it (sprint planning)
6 Finding techniques, ensuring quality and facilitating the scrum
7 Monitoring quality and planning for the project.
8 Configuring the hard shoulder running (using CBA builder). 
9 Testing the cameras along the roadside and performing in FAT and SAT.
10 Building on software, the rotational panels, MSI’s and onder-stations for the road.
11 Configuring and testing of DOV-Lights and DOV-Lanes.
profile_positions.title: Lead Engineer

profile_positions.description:
1 Analyzing process and instrumentation diagrams (P&ID’s), making data flow diagrams (DFD’s)
2 Modeling every section of steam turbines and drawing process flow diagrams (PFD’s)
3 Designing various sophisticated controllers for the model developed.
4 Designing protection system for safeguarding (HAZOP).
5 Provided control philosophies and fail-safe flow calculations of HRSG plant for NEM.
6 Analyzing temperature-entropy diagrams and rankine cycle.
7 Providing heat mass balance, thermodynamically stable control system.
8 Provided fail-safe flow calculations of HRSG plant (using RTP PLC).
9 Designed 3 Element Boiler Level Control System (using Labview).
10 Provided solutions for non linear issues of control valves like hysteresis, biogas flow opening etc.
11 Commissioning and ensuring that the equipment works according to its specification.
Analyzing biogas flow control system (using NanoCAD).
12 Retrofit of Mechanical Governor Control with latest State of the Art Electro-Mechanical
Governing System (using Woodward 505).
13 Modification enabled droop control of Steam Turbines & provided an ease to operators in
controlling the Steam Turbine (using Matlab and Simulink)
profile_positions.title: Control System Engineer
